{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the preferred method for a newborn child who has not passed urine for 36 hours. According to Document [2], newborns usually pass urine within the first 24 hours of life. If a newborn has not passed urine within 48 hours, it is recommended to repeat the physical exam to evaluate genitals and abdomen for any missed abnormalities. If there are valid concerns about voiding, catheterization and ultrasound along with a urology consultation should take place. Therefore, the preferred method in this case would be an ultrasound of the kidney and bladder.", "answer_choice": "A"}
